trans-unit.source: Encapsulates the output cache initialization settings parsed from an [@ OutputCache](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28a9e101-fb44-4198-9cb6-b8a52312fec2) page directive by ASP.NET.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters> class is not used by ASP.NET page or control developers.

It provides a data structure used to store cache settings parsed from an [@ OutputCache](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28a9e101-fb44-4198-9cb6-b8a52312fec2) page directive by ASP.NET page and control parsers such as <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParser> and <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControlParser>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters> object is used with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.InitOutputCache%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to initialize the output cache for a page and its contents at run time.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters"></xref> class.
Gets or sets an <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile"></xref> name that is associated with the settings of the output cache entry.
The profile identifies a set of cache settings in the `<outputCacheSettings>` configuration that is used as the base settings for the output cache entry.
An <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile"></xref> name that is associated with the settings of the output cache entry.
Gets or sets the amount of time that a cache entry is to remain in the output cache.
The amount of time, in seconds, that a cache entry is to remain in the output cache.
The default is 0, which indicates an infinite duration.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether output caching is enabled for the current content.
`true` if output caching is enabled for the current content; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets a value that determines the location of the cache entry.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.OutputCacheLocation"></xref> values.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether the HTTP `Cache-Control: no-store` directive is set.
`true` if the `Cache-Control: no-store` directive is set on <xref href="System.Web.HttpResponse"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a set of database and table name pairs that the cache entry depends on.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters.SqlDependency%2A> string identifies databases and tables according to the name of a SQL Server cache dependency in your configuration (typically added using the `<sqlcachedependency>` configuration elements).

If you use SQL Server 2005, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters.SqlDependency%2A> property to "CommandNotification", which instructs ASP.NET to create row-level dependencies for all SQL commands issued within the context of the current ASP.NET page.
A string that identifies a set of database and table name pairs that the cache entry depends on.
The cache entry is expired when the table's data is updated or changes.
Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of character sets (content encodings) used to vary the cache entry.
When this property is set to multiple character sets, the output cache contains a different version of the requested document for each specified set.
<xref:System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters.VaryByContentEncoding%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
A list of character sets by which to vary the content.
Gets or sets a semicolon-delimited set of control identifiers contained within the current page or user control used to vary the current cache entry.
A semicolon-separated list of strings used to vary an entry's output cache.

The <xref href="System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters.VaryByControl"></xref> property is set to fully qualified control identifiers, where the identifier is a concatenation of control IDs starting from the top-level parent control and delimited with a dollar sign ($) character.
Gets a list of custom strings that the output cache uses to vary the cache entry.
If you specify "browser" for this property, the cache entry will be varied by browser type and major version number.
If a custom string is entered, you must override the <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication.GetVaryByCustomString%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in your application's Global.asax file.
The list of custom strings.
Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of header names used to vary the cache entry.
The header names identify HTTP headers associated with the request.
When this property is set to multiple headers, the output cache contains a different version of the requested document for each specified header.
A list of headers by which to vary the content.
Gets a semicolon-delimited list of query string or form POST parameters that the output cache uses to vary the cache entry.
When this property is set to multiple parameters, the output cache contains a different version of the requested document for each specified parameter.
Possible values include "none", "*", and any valid query string or POST parameter name.
The list of query string or form POST parameters.
